The claim states that under Scott Walker: Wisconsin "moved from 16th to third in percentage of people with student loan debt."
The claim was made by Scot Ross: the executive director of the liberal group One Wisconsin Now, during an appearance on "Upfront with Mike Gousha."
The Institute for College Access: Success reported that in 2015, Wisconsin students owed an average of $28,810, ranking the state third in the nation based on the percentage of students with debt.
